properties.name: 21st Amendment Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn A decent brewpub in San Francisco\'s SOMA neighborhood. Beer can be good, food can be pricey, atmosphere varies depending on time of day, day of week and whether the Giants are playing.

properties.name: 5th Quadrant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 3901 B N Williams Ave., portland, orI just like the name of this place, really, since Portland is the city with five quadrants. :-) This is an outpost of the New Old Lompoc Brewing Company, which now has three Portland locations.

properties.name: Amsterdam, The Netherlands
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnamsterdam, netherlandsWhere I stayed for two... or was it three nights? Great bicycling and stuff. Especially coffeehouses.

properties.name: Anchor Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1705 Mariposa St, San Francisco, CAMakers of Anchor Steam Beer, Anchor Liberty Ale, Anchor Porter, Anchor Bock and others. The quintessential San Francisco Beer. They give a great tour, too.

properties.name: Anchor Brewing Company -- SFO Pub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn San Francisco International AirportLocated in SFO\'s Terminal 3, Boarding Area F, near Gate 69, inside the Security Perimeter. They serve brew pub food as well as breakfast. Good to know if you\'re going to fly SFO!!

properties.name: Anderson Valley Brewing Company (Boonville Beer)
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnboonville, caBoont Amber Ale... yum!

properties.name: Aquarius Records SF
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1055 Valencia Street, San Francisco, California 94110Since 1970. SF\'s oldest independent record store. Small, though. you don\'t go here looking for a record you want. More to peruse the records that they sell.

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 144 11th st, astoria, orPreviously known as Pacific Rim Brewing Company, now Astoria Brewing Company. Where to go for good local beer in Astoria, OR!! (and boy might you need a good pint or three once that fog rolls in...)

properties.name: BPM Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn654 Fillmore, san francisco, caThis place has been around since 1991, though they\'ve recently moved up the hill from their old location on Hayes St, and may still be in the transition process. Lots of house music and some breaks and other electronica, with a little bit of reggae and other stuff thrown in for good measure.

properties.name: Barley Brown's Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 2190 Main St, Baker City, OR

properties.name: Beach Chalet/Park Chalet Brewery/Pub/Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn   fulton st and great highway, san francisco, caTechnically owned by the City of San Francisco, and located in Golden Gate Park, the Beach Chalet has some stunningly good brews to match the view across Great Highway of Ocean Beach. The food is different upstairs in the Beach Chalet from out back in the Park Chalet, and neither one is inexpensive. However, the lobby has some amazing art painted on its walls, and even the restrooms exude a touch of class.

properties.name: Big Horse Brewing Co
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn115 state st, hood river, orNote: Big Horse doesn\'t appear to have its own website, but don\'t let that stop you. This place has great beer, great food and *incredible* views of the Columbia River Gorge. I honestly don\'t know how you would decide between here and Full Sail\'s pub/tasting room, if you had a choice... you\'d have to visit both. Sure, Full Sail probably has better beer... but Big Horse has *good* beer and is worthy of a visit.

properties.name: Bill's Tavern & Brewhouse -
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn

properties.name: Bill's Tavern & Brewhouse/Warren House Pub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 3301 S Hemlock, Cannon Beach, OR

properties.name: Bill's Tavern/Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn188 n. hemlock, cannon beach, orComfortable town-center pub, wood-dominated decor, two-room pub with high ceilings and booths along the walls. Brewery is upstairs above the bar.

properties.name: Bison Brewing Co.
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  telegraph ave, berkeley, caNormally, I might not map a brewery that doesn\'t serve beer on the premises. However, Bison is special. For one, they *used* to serve their brews on the premises at the attached Bison Brewpub... until they inexplicably sold that facility and allowed it to turn into an Indian restaurant that does not actually serve their beer. For another, they\'re organic. And finally -- their beer rocks. So, this is where they are. If you\'re in the neighborhood during the day, drop by and hassle them about opening a brewpub again, or at least try and talk them into giving you a taster. It\'s good shite, man! Alternatively, I think most of the grocery stores nearby will sell their stuff by the bottle. This is one of the only organic breweries in California, still, so it\'s worth checking out if you see it in a bottle at the store. I especially enjoy their Belgian Ale and their Gingerbread Ale. :-)

Rumor has it that men must wear a jacket and no jeans. However, of course, the view is astounding.

They encourage you to drop in for a pint to enjoy with food, or to take into the theater to enjoy with your movie!! (Can you even take one in with you while you watch the Rocky Horror Picture Show on Saturday nights, I wonder?) :-)

properties.name: DPW Village
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThis is the base of operations for the Black Rock City Department of Public Works. These guys are nuts. Stay out of their way if you can. If you can\'t, they can be bribed with cold beer and other things. This makes them friendly. :-)

properties.name: Eldo's Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1326 9th ave, sf, caThey brew their own and serve it on tap, and have a spanish-themed menu. The best bet for beer at the trendy 9th & Irving neighborhood. Also, they\'re across the street from Arizmendi\'s Bakery.

properties.name: Eldo's N-Judah Stop @ 9th & Irving
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThis is where you get off the N-Judah to get to Eldo\'s Brewpub. 9th & Irving, the center of the Sunset universe!!

properties.name: Elliot Glacier Public House
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  4945 Baseline Road, parkdale, orAh, Parkdale, Oregon. Such a special little town. It boasts of its own short-line railroad connecting it directly to Hood River, OR, a RR that is unique because, during the course of its climb up out of the Columbia River Gorge, it negotiates a switchback that actually requires the train the reverse direction and travel the remainder of the route backwards in order to get up and out of the canyon. Fascinating. In any case, this is a great place to grab a microbrew if you happen to be among the pear and other fruit orchards in Parkdale, OR.

properties.name: Elliot Glacier Public House
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 4945 Baseline Road, parkdale, or

properties.name: Genoa, Italy
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnGenoa, ItalyI spent a night here in the summer of 1996... incidentally, this is the city where Christopher Columbus hailed from. Great seafood, nice walkable central city, charming overall...

properties.name: Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 2 Harrison St, San Francisco, CAWhile I hesitate to call Gordon Biersch a brewpub, they do apparently brew their own beer, and serve it in a facility alongside food. Technically, though they are a large, nationwide chain, that does satisfy the definition. Did I mention that they\'re a large, nationwide chain? They charge more for dinners than for lunches -- significantly more -- just because they can. i.e. no sub-0 sandwiches after, say, 3pm. And, they\'re frequented by lots of yuppies, noisy tourists, families of midwesterners (not that I have anything against midwesterners), etc. So... visit at your own peril.

properties.name: Grandviews Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn345 Stockton St, sf, caLocated at the top of the Grand Hyatt Union Square.

properties.name: Green Gorilla Burningman Camp at Black Rock City, NV
properties.description: Posted by Garlynngerlach, nv...more precisely, this is about where the Green Gorilla Lounge set up camp in 2005. :-)

properties.name: Groove Merchant Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn687 Haight St, San Francisco, CAThey\'ve got a listening station and they\'re tiny!!

properties.name: Hair of the Dog Brewery
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnOh yeah, these guys brew up the schizz-nick!! If you haven\'t had their beer yet, it comes from here. Most likely, you\'ve gotta be in Oregon to find it.

properties.name: Half Moon Bay Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 390 Capistrano Avenue, Princeton-by-the-Sea, CA 94019Where to go for micro-brewed beer in Half Moon Bay. They\'re definitely appreciate your business right now, as the closure of Devil\'s Slide has meant that no business arrives from San Francisco from the north via Highway One until that route re-opens... and Caltrans has predicted that the closure may last through September, 2006. But, there are other, longer ways to get here (Hwy 92, mainly, or hey, drive north from Santa Cruz, or take a boat, or fly into the convenient Moss Beach Field airport...) Decently-good beer, decent food, and a very large space with live music make this a pretty happening beer spot by-the-sea.

properties.name: Hayward BART Station
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn699 \'B\' Street Hayward, 94541Access to the Hayward Bistro, Buffalo Bill\'s Brewery (and, by extension, the rest of downtown Hayward).

properties.name: Hayward Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1001 B Street, Hayward, CA 94541"Too Hip For Hayward." That\'s actually the name of one of the sandwiches on their menu. I kinda think it sums the whole place up. Great beer selection, decent food, good urban location, and walking distance from downtown Hayward BART! In Hayward, at least, what more could you want?

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 4534 Southeast Belmont Street, Portland, OR, 97215Over 50 beers on tap! Single malt scotch, full bar, full menu, lunch & dinner daily, breakfast sat & sun, kitchen open late -- and the denset, smokiest cigarette haze in a fine beer establishment in Portland. Enter at your own risk. Your clothes will reek after two minutes in this place.

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  310 NE. Evans St., McMinnville, OR, United States

properties.name: Housewares
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1322 Haight Street, sf, caUnverified listing -- heard of this place, haven\'t visited. They may or may not sell records. They probably don\'t let you listne to them. Let me know if you visit, or I\'ll update once I do.

properties.name: Hyunh
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn381 15th St, Oakland, CAI love the name of this place. I pronounce it like I\'m not quite sure what somebody said ("Huh?") except I say it very loudly and add an "n" to the end of it. I amuse myself. All that aside, this place is great. Higher-end Vietnamese, delicious little appetizers, great decor... and generally a waiting list/line during the peak of the lunch hour for larger parties. Well worth it, or just get there slightly before noon or after 1pm.

properties.name: InHouse Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnmission st & 6th st, san francisco, caJust a bit down Mission Street from 6th Street, upstairs on the second floor of a building in a run-down section of town, is InHouse Records. Featuring five listening stations and a whole lotta house music on vinyl. No CDs or tapes to speak of, but these guys do seem to know their stuff. Lots of white labels, too.

properties.name: Ital Calabash
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  1405 Franklin St, Oakland, CAVegan African-Jamaican Soul Food. Run by rastas. Playing Reggae all da time, mon. This place is definitely exclusively lunch-only. It is also currently for sale, so it may not be open much longer here... I believe they\'re going to concentrate more on their Berkeley location, at Ashby & Adeline.

properties.name: John Harvard's Brew House
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn2093 Smithhaven Plaza, Lake Grove, NY 11755This chain features Brewmaster D.J. Swanson at this brewpub location.

properties.name: John's Market
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 3535 SW Multnomah, Portland, OR

properties.name: Jupiter Alehouse
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn2181 Shattuck Ave, Berkeley, CAThough often over-run by college students from Cal (UC California @ Berkeley, called "Cal" in honor of its status as the first member of the state higher education system), this brewpub offers up a fine selection of brews, a large backyard with water and fire sculptures, live music outside, two levels inside, and pizza.

properties.name: Karlsson Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 35900 Industrial Way, Sandy OR

properties.name: King Wah
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 383 9th St, Oakland, CAOK, so the service here isn\'t exactly always friendly, and it looks like you\'re in the galley on the inside of a ship. The food is some of the better Chinese food in Oakland\'s Chinatown (that is, Cantonese food -- the recent crop of Szechuan places is a different story). The clay pots are good, the sizzling dishes are good, and they will take requests as well.

properties.name: La Estrellita Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 446 E 12th St, Oakland, 94606Good Mexican Restaurant/Bar, with live music some nights. Their chicken mole is especially good.

properties.name: Lagunitas Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  1280 North McDowell Boulevard, petaluma, caThese guys are a blast -- and they make great beer, too!!

properties.name: Laurelwood Public House
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1728 ne 40th ave, portland, orA great little certified-organic brewpub in the Hollywood district of NE Portland. You can see their shiny basement brewery from the pub, and it certainly looks like an impressive operation!! Makes you want to quaff one of their fine beers and have some of their tasty food to go along with it.

properties.name: Liberator Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn411 East Columbia River Highway, troutdale, orThe brewpub for downtown Troutdale -- not to be confused with that much larger place, the former poorhouse outside of town, this one is much quainter and closer to the river.

Arcata is all in all a much nicer town just on the other side of the bay), and the Lost Coast is a pretty cool place to invoke as a name.

properties.description: Posted by GarlynnMexcaltitán, mexicoThis is supposedly the ancestral home of the Aztecs. I stayed here in 2003... beautiful little car-free island village, only accessible by lancha.

properties.name: Mickey Finn's Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn4336 se woodstock blvd, portland, orIf you happen to be in the Woodstock neighborhood of Portland, Mickey Finn\'s is a great place to grab a bite to eat and a beer. Not only do they have 26 rotating taps, but their onion rings kick butt.

properties.name: Mill Creek Brewpub/ Big House Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 11 South Palouse, Walla Walla, WashingtonThe place to go for home-made brews in Walla Walla, Washington... a town that has always seemed to be like it really belongs in Oregon. Must be because it\'s on the Oregon side of the Snake River. Oregon got robbed!! :-) And yes, I should mention something about onions and onion rings and seasonality, but I won\'t.

properties.name: Montreal!
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnWas in Montreal for Spring Break 1996, loved the old French Quarter, the subway/buses, the downtown, the restaurants... great city!! Friendly people, too.

properties.name: Mt. Hood Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn87304 E. Government Camp Loop, government camp, orThe Brewery with Altitude!! (heh) :-) Ya know, if you\'re up on Mt. Hood and you need a really good, fresh beer, this is the place to go. Oh, sure, Timberline Lodge has great beers on tap and it\'s all historic and stuff, but this place makes their own. \'Nuff said. Plus, it\'s on the way home. :-)

properties.name: Mulege, Mexico (Playa de Coyote)
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnmulege, mexicoStayed here for a little while during the 2002-2003 xmas/new year\'s trip, on the beach!! Glowing night-time ocean organisms, anyone?

properties.name: New World Vegetarian Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 464 8th St, Oakland, CA 94607A good vegetarian restaurant in downtown Oakland, featuring a variety of dishes, not just Asian but also Mexican- themed. Quite tasty. Good atmosphere and location in Old Oakland, too.

properties.name: North Coast Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn455 north main st, fort bragg, caThey claim to be one of the 10 best breweries in the world. I dunno about that... but their beer is pretty good. Fort Bragg is a cute little town, too.

properties.name: Oakland Grill
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn301 Franklin St, Oakland, CAThey claim to be among the 100 best restaurants in the United States. I dunno about that. They do, however, have one of the 100 best crab-cake sandwiches in the world. Without a doubt. There is ONE reason to go here, and that is the crab-cake sandwich. It features a honey-mustard sauce, and I get it on the baguette. Delicious, especially with an Anchor Steam to wash it down with and some fries on the side.

properties.name: Oasis Restaurant & Bar
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 135 12th St, Oakland, CAHalfway-decent african cuisine and sandwiches adorn the menu. They\'ve got a full bar and a split personality -- they serve folks from the Alameda County Courthouse during the day (mainly lawyers, county employees and the like), and by night they\'re one of the east bay\'s most happening dance spots, featuring both indoor and outdoor DJ\'d dancefloors. Good for lunch? Service can lag at times, but no complaints about the food, and the prices aren\'t too high (but aren\'t dirt-cheap, either.)

properties.name: Old Market Pub & Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 6959 Southwest Garden Home Road, Portland, OR, 97223(503)BIG-BEER

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn140 Hill Street NE, albany, orOne of the few breweries to actually have a selection of bocks produced -- this is the place to go for good beer in Albany, OR!

properties.description: Posted by GarlynnMexican/ Fresh Mex style lunch joint. Great salsa bar, decent beer selection in bottles, decent menu, and it\'s right on the City Hall Plaza. Good lunch joint!

properties.description: Posted by GarlynnPacific City, OregonRumored to have some of the best beer anywhere, they also have some of the best views and a pretty good menu, to boot. But, the prices are astronomical, Pacific City looks like it was transplanted wholesale from southern California, and loads of tourists abound.

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn251 8th St, Oakland, CA, 94607The best Cambodian restaurant around.... great, friendly service, good menu, good atmosphere. Sometimes a line at lunch, especially for medium-sized groups (over 2).

properties.name: Pho 84
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn354 17th St, Oakland, CAPho 84 is another popular downtown Oakland vietnamese restaurant. It\'s small, and can have a line/waiting list during the lunch peak. The food, however, is delicious, and the daily specials should be paid attention to. Some of them are quite tasty...

properties.name: Pho To Do Vietnamese Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn This place has changed hands one too many times in the past few years for me to keep up with what the current name may be. Still, it\'s the only Vietnamese place on this block, and it still delivers good, cheap food, including decently-good Pho.

properties.name: Pisa, Italy
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnpisa, italyI stayed a block from the leaning tower for a night, in a hotel with an attached bath with a bidet, for 0 a night! Summer of 1996....

properties.name: Portland Brewing Co. Pizza Pub at PDX
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn portland international airportIf you\'re at PDX, this is the place to come for a pint or two and some grub. They\'ve got... a crapload of beer, not just their own but also a large number of guest taps. Highly recommended for any visit to Portland\'s airport.

properties.name: Portland Office of Transportation
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1120 SW 5th ave, portland, orDid GIS/Engineering in the Street Systems Section of the Portland Office of Transportation, in the Portland Building, just behind Portlandia!!

properties.name: Quebec City, Quebec
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnquebec city, quebecNorth America\'s only remaining walled city, whose walls were built to protect it against an American invasion. I visited here during Spring Break 1996... and it snowed. :-) Great place, good beer, good wine, good food... friendly people!

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1520 se 7th portland or 97214Portland\'s first documented organic brewpub. Huzzah!

properties.name: Russian River Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn729 4th St., Santa Rosa, CA, United StatesOriginally part of the Korbel property (famous for their champagne), this has since grown up and moved out to a more downtown location near Santa Rosa\'s plaza.

properties.name: Saddle Mountain
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThis is Saddle Mountain. As the website says, it\'s only 2. 5 miles to the top... ...but you\'d better be prepared. It\'s a very diverse two miles. And steep. And dangerous in parts. But from the top, on a clear day, you can see for hundreds of miles... to Mt. Hood and many of the other peaks of the Cascades, up and down the Coast Range, out to sea... it\'s an amazing view. Sunsets are spectacular from up there. But don\'t forget to bring some flashlights for the way back down if you don\'t intend to spend the night!

properties.name: Salamanca, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnsalamanca, spainWhere I lived for a month during the summer of 1996, studying espanish ;-)

properties.name: San Francisco Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThe San Francisco Brewing Company is located in what may be the last remaining saloon building from the Barbary Coast era. This place exudes history, in a sort of old-west-charm kind of way. Their beer rotates frequently, but is generally quite good. The happy hours are a good time to drop in and sample their selection.

properties.name: Santa Cruz Mountain Organic Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn402 ingalls st, santa cruz, caA fully-organic brewery, with a tasting room open on the weekends. Definitely worth a visit to taste their all-organic beer, if you happen to find yourself in Santa Cruz!!

properties.name: Seabright Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn519 seabright ave, santa cruz, ca"Santa Cruz\'s Favorite Brewpub". Without a doubt. If you\'re in Santa Cruz, this is the brewpub to visit. Good beer, good food, close to Seabright Beach.

properties.name: Sebastopol Brewing Co
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn268 Petaluma Ave, Sebastopol, CAAfter a long, hard day wine tasting in western Sonoma County, I like to top it all off with a nice meal and a beer. Luckily, this place is in a convenient location for that! It used be be known as the Powerhouse Brewing Co, and is located in the historic powerhouse for the electric railroad that used to run between Sebastopol and Santa Rosa.

properties.name: Secret Kansas Street Pedestrian Path
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnMost people think that Kansas Street does not go through. Including many people who actually live on Kansas Street. However, this is simply not the case. If you\'re a pedestrian, or a bicylist willing to heft your bike on your shoulder, it does, in fact, go through. And this is where. Just keep going. From the bottom, look for the little dirt staircase to your right. From the top -- that fence is an optical illusion, you can actually walk right through it, and there\'s a little concrete staircase going down in the middle.

properties.name: Shady Cove, OR
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn   Shady Cove, ORMy family\'s pad in Shady Cove

properties.name: Shady Cove, OR
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  Shady Cove, ORMy family\'s land, and the surrounding Rogue River Valley

properties.name: Shady Cove, Oregon
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn101 Madrone, Shady Cove, OR 97539Shady Cove, Oregon -- on the Rogue River between Crater Lake and Medford!

properties.name: Siam Bay Thai Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1009 Clay St, Oakland, CAThough some are put off by its all-you-can-eat lunch buffet, this authentic Thai restaurant actually does serve up some of the best Thai food in the East Bay. They hand-make their own curries, and also make a mean Evil Jungle Noodle dish. The decor takes you to Thailand, with wood carvings everywhere, and the service is always pleasant.

properties.name: Sierra Market & Deli
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnSierra Market & DeliNew market/deli with decent sandwiches, beverages, chips... and cans of campbell\'s soup and other corner-store fare. In a brand-new building, with good industrial design and a huge-screen TV on the wall. Always a line out the door at lunch.

properties.name: Siletz Ales
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 243 N Gaither St, Siletz, OR

properties.name: Site of the Temple
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnWhere the Temple is generally built, further out from the city than the Man.

properties.name: Soizic Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 300 Broadway, Oakland, CASoizic probably isn\'t for everybody. But, you know, it\'s a nice place to eat if you want to shell out a chunk of change for lunch! I mean, it\'s not all that much in the grand scheme of things, and the food is tasty, even if the portions a bit small. That is to say, Soizic lends a touch of class to dining in the downtown Oakland/Jack London area.

properties.name: Some beach east of San Jose del Cabo, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  san jose del cabo, mexicoWe stayed here for Xmas 2003 on the beach. Or, at least, at some beach out on this road about 10 miles past san jose del cabo...

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1360 redwood way, petaluma, caWorked with GIS and Air Quality in year 2000.

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn40 Bowden Square, Southampton NY 11968Brewpub featuring Brewmaster Phil Markowski

properties.name: Southern Oregon Brewing Co.
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1922 United Way, Medford, OR

properties.name: Spacelounge (R.I.P.)
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnSpacelounge. The flyest nightclub on the playa, in its time. 1997-2002.

properties.name: Spaten Brewery Munich
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn Marsstr. 16, 80335 München, GermanyThe home of Spaten, a brewery which is hundreds of years old and still produces one of the better dopplebocks anywhere, despite its status as the second-largest German export brewery.

properties.name: St Viateur Bagel Shop
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 263 St-Viateur Street West, Montreal, QCRumored to have the best bagels in the world. Me and my Jewish friend from New Jersey both agreed that, indeed, we had never tasted finer bagels anywhere else. And he\'s a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, a bona-fide chef. But don\'t take our word for it. Skeptical? Go to Montreal. Go to this bagel shop. Get a dozen bagels (yeah, just try deciding on one). Eat them. Comment below. ;-)

properties.name: Standing Stone Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn101 oak st, ashland, orStanding Stone Brewing Company (541) 482-9459

properties.name: Steelhead Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 199 E 5th Ave, Eugene, OR

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  This is supposedly what the original Stonehenge would have looked like when it was first built. It\'s a war memorial to the dead of World War I, who died mainly while engaging in trench warfare. It was financed by the builder of the Maryhill Mansion/Museum in memoriam of his own experiences with the horror of war, and the solace that he found when he visited the original Stonehenge.

properties.name: Streetlight Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn3979 24th St, San Francisco, CAThey don\'t let you listen, but they\'ve got a selection.

properties.name: Sublounge (R.I.P.)
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnFor a few years, this was the best little DJ Bar, best Burning Man Bar, and best small nightclub in San Francisco, according to SF Weekly polls. Owned by burners, by members of the Spacelounge theme camp, by cool folks. Unfortunately, its very underground-ness, and off-the-beaten-path-ness, was what did it in. Not enough daily food traffic, and not enough promotion, put it out of business.

properties.name: Tamarindo
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn468 8th St, Oakland, CA, 94607An expensive Tapas place. *rant mode on* Tapas is the Spanish meal that\'s intended to be eaten after one awakes from Siesta, in order to put a little food in the tummy that will last until Cena, which is the evening meal. Almuerzo is the mid-day meal, and occurs at about 2pm. Tapas occur between 5 and 7pm, and are like the breakfast that you eat after you wake up from your afternoon nap. Cena occurs around 10pm, so you\'ll need a little something to last you until then. In Spain during the summer, when it\'s hot, you also won\'t want to eat a large amount of food at this time of day. You will, however, want a touch of wine to wash it down with. Tapas are perfectly appropriate as an accompaniment to after-work drinks, as they were well-suited to that role. Tapas, however, are generally too small in portion to substitute for a real meal, such as lunch, unless you want to spend a *lot* of money on that meal, or you\'re a really finnicky small bird of an eater. *rant off* This place does Tapas well, if you\'re willing to pay for it, in a well-designed atmosphere and featuring sidewalk seating, in Old Oakland.

properties.name: Tampico, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnTampico, MexicoMy Mom and I stayed here during our Xmas vacation in 1986.

properties.name: Thai Corner
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn15th st and franklin st, oakland, caAwesome new little Thai place. You go to the lunch bar, order, pay, give them your name. They make it. Call your name. You pick it up on a tray, eat it, then bus your own table. Yeah, OK, sounds like a boring cafeteria, right? WRONG. This place kicks arse. One side fo the menu is vegan, the other is not. And both sides are full of little tasty treats... oh so yummy! and cheap, too!

properties.name: The Amsterdam Cafe/Pub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  23 Broadway, Fairfax CaliforniaIf you\'re ever lucky enough to find yourself in Fairfax, CA, stop in here for a pint or two and a bite to eat. They\'ve got live music at night and a great back patio during the day. They also have in the past had the Caledonian beer on tap!!

properties.name: The Back Stage Bar
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn

properties.name: The Bier Stein Bottleshop & Pub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 345 E 11th Ave, Eugene, OR(541)485-2437

properties.name: The Caledonian Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  Edinburgh, EH11 1PH, United KingdomOK, so this brewery is NOT on the West Coast of the United States. Let\'s just make that perfectly clear. :-) However, their organically-grown ale is just SO DAMNED TASTY GOOD that I had to include it on this map. Sometimes, if you\'re REALLY, REALLY lucky, you\'ll find it on tap here in the United States. I once saw it at the Amsterdam Pub in Fairfax, CA. Otherwise, you\'ll have to look for it in the bottle, and a good beer importer will probably carry it. Give it a try -- isn\'t it tasty? Just a reference point for how good an organic beer can be. And to show that no, we don\'t quite have a monopoly on good beer here on the West Coast. :-)

properties.name: The City Beer Store & Tasting Bar
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn   1168 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: The Ghetto Vic
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn94110In San Francisco\'s Potrero Slope/Mission District, Near General Hospital.

properties.name: The Gingerbread House
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 741 5th St, Oakland, CAThe gingerbread house is New Orleans food done theatrically, and thus, perhaps, as it should be. Disclaimer: I\'ve never been to New Orleans. But I\'ve been here, and I\'d recommend it, especially for large groups.

properties.name: The Heartland Brewing Co.
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn35 Union Square W, New York, NYA brewpub for Union Square.

properties.name: The Marine Mammal Center
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnTreatment center for marine mammals -- primarily elephant seals, sea lions and harbor seals, but other as well.

properties.name: The Portland Building
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1201 SW 5th Ave, Portland, OR 97201

properties.name: The Ram Big Horn Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn

properties.name: The Starlight Room
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn450 powell st, sf, caDunno who this narcissistic Harry Denton fellow is, but this restaurant seems to be as much about him as about the location, if you want to take the web page seriously (i.e. every photo is of him, as opposed to the restaurant or views). The views, however, are good, even if not completely panoramic. The food is decent, the bridge & tunnel crowd turns out to fill the dancefloor every now and then, and the drink prices are -- well -- seems like all the cocktails are about 0, and beer doesn\'t seem to be their specialty. That being said, the whole point of this place is to throw good parties, and what could possibly be wrong with that?

properties.name: The Trappist
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThe newest addition to the Oakland beer scene, The Trappist serves up Belgian and other specialty beers in a bar that, aside from that new smell, looks like it could have been in its Victorian building since it was built in 1890 -- yet, The Trappist just celebrated its grand opening party on Friday, December 7th, 2007, after spending the past year building out a bar space from scratch.

properties.name: The View
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn55 4th st, sf, ca"The View" sits atop the San Francisco Marriott hotel, which is referred to as the "Jukebox" by some locals because of its scalloped shape. It opened on October 17, 1989, the day the city experienced its second-most-famous earthquake, during the final game of the World Series between the A\'s and the Giants (the stress between the two sides of the bay was just too much for the fault line to take).

properties.name: The White Eagle Saloon
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn836 N. Russell St., portland, orVariously described as the oldest bar in Portland, the longest bar in Portland, and as being haunted. My Dad\'s band, the Batz, used to play here before those sissies the McMenamins bought it and decided that they couldn\'t allow real RAWK&RAWL here any longer. Oh, well. At least it probably serves better beer now?

properties.name: Third Street Ale Works
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn610 3rd st, santa rosa, caThe original Santa Rosa brewpub, this place was near Santa Rosa\'s plaza well before Russian River Brewing decided to vacate the Korbel premises and move to some more urban digs a few years back. It gets great reviews, and as it does offer some pretty decent grub and a not-half-bad selection of brews, it\'s worth stopping by if you happen to be near Santa Rosa.

properties.name: Three Creeks Brewing Co.
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 721 Desperado Ct., Sisters, OR(541)977-7800. As of May, 2008: "Coming Soon! Check Website for Opening Date" -- Opening August, 2008.

properties.name: Top of Mt. Tamalpais -- East Peak
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThis is the "top" of Mt. Tam, for the purposes of hiking to the top to get the best view. Mt. Tam is more of a ridge than a mountain, but as such, this is the top.

properties.name: Top of the Mark
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn999 california st, sf, caThe Top of the Mark sits on the top floor of the InterContinental Mark Hopkins Hotel in San Francisco. One of the oldest and ritziest skyscraping lounges around anywhere, the last remodelling job unfortunately removed one entire quarter of the view (to the south, I believe) by installing a poorly-planned kitchen/storage room. So, rather than offering 360-degree views, it offers 270-degree views. Also, the drink prices are stiff, while the drinks are not. Finally, there seem to be an *awful* lot of Republicans roaming about this joint, and the staff seems sniffy.

properties.name: Toronado Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn547 Haight San Francisco, CA 94117If you happen to be in San Francisco, and you like Belgian beers, you should probably drop in here for a pint or three. There\'s a good sausage/hot dog shop next door if you need a bite to eat. If the bartender is surly, just remember that you\'re in California, which is NOT the friendliest place in the world. But hey, the beer is great. :-)

properties.name: Toronado Streetcar Stop
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnYou can catch the MUNI N-Judah or the J-Church to here, and then walk the three blocks to the Toronado.

properties.name: Treasure Island
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn100 Avenue of the Palms, San Francisco, CATreasure Island. What if it sinks? http://undergroundscience.blogspot.com/2006/12/what-if-treasure-island-sinks.html

properties.name: Treasure Island
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnSan Francisco, CA

properties.name: Tri-Met Capital Projects Office
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1110 ne holladay st, portland, orInterned with the Tri-Met Westside Light Rail Office, 1997-1998

properties.name: Triple Rock Brewery/Pub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1920 shattuck ave, berkeley, caClaiming to be one of the first five brewpubs in the United States, this is at least one of the first five in Berkeley. Their beer is decently good, depending on what they have on their rotation, and their food isn\'t half-bad, either, though it tends to be a bit on the expensive side for standard pub fare. The upstairs patio is a nice touch. The sports TVs everywhere could go. Surprisingly, given its proximity to the UC Berkeley campus, it is not always over-run by frat-belonging sports-fan students.

properties.name: Tweekin Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn593 Haight St, San Francisco, CAOne of San Francisco\'s best DJ-oriented record stores. Features five vinyl (& 1 CD) listening stations, in addition to a vast array of house music, plus some dub, reggae and others thrown in for variety. The owners are all respected SF house music DJs, as well. Tell them you found them on Garlynn\'s map. :-)

properties.name: VICTORY
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 3652 SE Division St, Portland, OR

properties.name: Venice, Italy
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnMy favorite city in Italy -- car-free Venice!!

properties.name: Veracruz, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnVeracruz, MexicoMy Mom and I stayed here in 1986 during our Xmas vacation from Chihuahua. I think she had to pawn her camera for us to get the cash to continue the vacation, until our wire transfer came in from the states. We were here for a while, eating oysters and crackers, hot dogs, corn on a stick....

properties.name: Vermont St- The Other Curviest Street In The World
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnSure, a lot of people think that Lombard St is the curviest in the world, but Vermont St in Potrero Hill is, at the very least, just as curvy. With fewer tourists.

properties.name: Verona, Italy
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnVerona, ItalyI stayed here, in the city of Romeo and Juliet, in the summer of 1996. Charming little northern Italian hill-town. You can still go see Juliet\'s balcony. Romeo\'s house, however, is not so accessible.

properties.name: Wakonda Brewing Co.
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1725 Kingwood St., #4, Florence, OR(541)991-0694

properties.name: Walkabout Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 5204 Dobrot Way, Central Point, OR(541)664-7763, call for tour info.

properties.name: Wild Fire Brewing Co
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 20750 High Desert Ln, #107, Bend, OR(541)585-1007, brewery only.

properties.name: Wild River Brewing & Pizza Co
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 2684 N Pacific Hwy, Medford, OR

properties.name: Wild River Brewing & Pizza Co.
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 249 Redwood Hwy, Cave Junction, OR

properties.name: Wild River Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 16279 Hwy 101, Brookings Harbor, OR

properties.name: Wild River Pub & Publik House
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 533 NE F St, Grants Pass, OR

properties.name: Willamette Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1055 Madera St, Eugene, OR(541)688-4555 call for tour info

properties.name: Wisdom Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn4308 Mission St, San Francisco, CAWisdom Records -- THE source for reggae, dub, and dancehall. That\'s all they do. And they do it well. Run by rastas, with a single listening station, way the f* out on Mission Street, almost to Daly City... well, actually, not quite that far out, which always throws me as I overshoot it when I\'m trying to find it. Look hard. It\'s upstairs, you have to ring the buzzer to get buzzed in, and the sign is SMALL. Lots of 7" as well as 12".

properties.name: Woodsong Brewing Co
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 111 Myrtle Street, Suite 204, Oakland, CALike the original location of Woodsong Brewing Co, this isn\'t really fair to list on the map, as you\'ll probably have to know me to get invited in & given some actual beer to drink. However... you never know, you might get lucky (or inspired)! Anyway, this is where the magic currently happens.

properties.name: World Grounds Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 308 Jackson St, Oakland, CAA coffee shop that also serves some simple sandwich-type food and has a couple of beers on tap, generally Sierra and F(l)at Tire. If that\'s your thing, go for it! I used to like it better when they had 1664 on tap as their third beer, but ever since they dropped that one... well... Good art on the walls, usually, and sometimes a bit of cello performance in the back. Also, they\'re rumored to have a decent wine happy hour some afternoons.

properties.name: Yelapa, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnpuerto vallarta, mexicoAccessible by about an hour-long lancha ride from the docks south of Puerto Vallarta, themselves reachable by city bus from the center of the city, Yelapa offers a beautiful car-free village in the middle of the jungle, with some nice waterfalls within day-hiking distance. We stayed here in 2003, in a palapa off the beach.

properties.name: Zazoo's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 15 Embarcadero W, Oakland, CAA surprisingly empty restaurant, given its prime waterfront location. Seems like it should also be a happening hub for nightlife, but I don\'t see any indication that this is the case. Anybody who knows otherwise should post a comment here... The food is nothing to write home about, but also not very expensive, especially given the location. And there\'s a full bar.

properties.name: Zen City Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn105 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA"Dance Music": Some house, some of that other stuff... and listening stations, so you can tell what it sounds like. Crucial, that last bit.

properties.name: Zurich, Switzerland
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnzurich, switzerlandI stayed here for a couple of nights in the summer of 1996, and took a day-long self-guided train tour of the country in between.

properties.name: the baseMent pub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1028 SE 12th avenue, portland, orAnother neighborhood SE Portland brewpub with decent beer and decent food at decent prices. AWWW YEAH!!

properties.name: wild river brewing & pizza
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn
